post.description: Creating a client session generates a client token: a temporary key used to initialize [Universal Checkout](https://primer.io/docs/accept-payments/setup-universal-checkout/installation/web) and authenticate it against your account. Universal Checkout automatically retrieves all the settings from the client session and the Dashboard to configure the payment methods and the checkout experience. Note: When creating a Client Session, please make sure to provide `currencyCode`, `orderId`, and at least one of `amount` or `lineItems`. If any of these are not yet available, you can provide them w hen making the payment request. POST /client-session does not have required fields as all fields are not always known when a client session is created. Use PATCH /client-session to update the parameters throughout the checkout session. Client tokens expire after 24 hours.

error.description: The client token is invalid.
error.recoverySuggestion: Please provide a valid client token.

error.description: We were unable to validate your request, please check your payload against https://primer.io/docs/api

errors.description: Value must be a valid string

get.description: This API call retrieves all the details associated with the client session corresponding to the client token that is provided in the request. The fields with empty values are excluded from the response.

parameters.description: Client token corresponding to the client session to retrieve

schema.title: Client Token
schema.description: Client token

parameters.name: clientToken

patch.description:
You can update a clients session created earlier with the `PATCH /client-session` [API call](#operation/create_client_side_token_client_session_post).

The only required field for the request is `clientToken`. Other supported request fields are same as for the `POST /client-session` [API call](#operation/create_client_side_token_client_session_post).

You need to specify only the fields you wish to update. However, if the items that are to be updated are of type `array`, then you need to provide the complete array along with modified items.

If you wish to update nested fields on the client session, such as the customer `emailAddress` field, you can pass the `customer` object with only one field, `emailAddress`, to update.

If you simply wish to clear the value of the field, pass `null` as your input.

You can update `paymentMethod.vaultOnSuccess` field but updating of the `paymentMethod.options` field through `PATCH /client-session` is not supported.

The response will contain all the fields of the client session including the ones that were changed.

get.description:
<p/>

Retrieve a list of your payments.

Results are paginated, they will only return up to 100 payments maximum.
To access the next page of result, set the `cursor` query parameter to the value of `nextCursor` in
your current result payload. Use `prevCursor` to go back to the previous page.

**Note:** this endpoint returns a list of
summarized payments. Not all payments attributes are present. You can use
the query parameters to filter payments. You can separate multiple query parameters with the `&` symbol.
Query parameters with types of the form "Array of strings" (such as the status parameter) can be specified as a comma-separated list.

**Note:** payments will be available within a minute from being created.

post.description:
<p/>

Create and authorize a payment for a given customer order. You
should provide a payment method token here to avoid PCI implications.

If only a payment method token is passed, the values passed with the Client Session is used to determine the amount, currency etc.
Note: `amount`, `currencyCode` and `orderId` are required during payment creation. Make sure to pass these fields when creating a client session, or if not yet available, when creating a payment.

All fields provided on this request will take preference over any field on the `order` associated with the client session. E.g. if you pass `amount` on this request, it will override the `amount` on the `order` associated with the Client Session.
Parameters that are not on this request will be fetched from previously created Client Session and merged. E.g. if you specify `customer.billingAddress` in Client Session and then pass `customer.emailAddress` data with this request, it will automatically merge the `customer` fields and use both `billingAddress` and `emailAddress` for later calculations.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional key to make the request idempotent. Learn more in the [Idempotency Key guide](../docs#idempotency-key).

error.description: The payment could not be created.
Missing fields for payment.
error.recoverySuggestion: When creating a payment `amount` must either be provided via the Client Session or the Payment request.

post.description:
<p/>

Manually authorize a payment using a provided processor. This is useful if you want to authorize a payment without a workflow action.
The processor merchant ID must be provided which can be found on the [Integrations page](https://dashboard.primer.io/integrations).
The processor name is optional but it must be provided if your account has multiple processors configured which share the same merchant IDs.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the payment to authorize.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional key to make the request idempotent. Learn more in the [Idempotency Key guide](../docs#idempotency-key).

error.description: The payment has already been authorized
A settled payment cannot be authorized
The merchant account could not be found
More than one merchant account was found for the provided processor merchant ID
The payment could not be found
The idempotency key "1234567898" already exists for transaction
We were unable to validate your request, please check your payload against https://primer.io/docs/api

errors.description: Value must be a valid string

post.description:
<p/>

If you have successfully authorized a payment, you can now
fully capture, or partially capture funds from the authorized payment, depending
on whether your selected payment processor supports it. The payment will
be updated to `SETTLED` or `SETTLING`, depending on the payment method type.

The payload sent in this capture request is completely optional. If you don't
send a payload with the capture request, the full amount that was authorized
will be sent for capture. Below are the available payload attributes, which
give you more granular control when capturing funds, if you require it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the payment to capture.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional key to make the request idempotent. Learn more in the [Idempotency Key guide](../docs#idempotency-key).

error.description: The payment could not be found
We were unable to validate your request, please check your payload against https://primer.io/docs/api

errors.description: Value must be a valid integer

post.description:
<p/>

Provided the payment has not reached `SETTLED` status, Primer will
send a "void" request to the payment processor, thereby cancelling the payment
and releasing the hold on customer funds. Upon success, the payment will transition
to `CANCELLED`. The payload is optional.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of payment to cancel.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional key to make the request idempotent. Learn more in the [Idempotency Key guide](../docs#idempotency-key).

error.description: The payment could not be found

post.description:
<p/>

By default, this request will refund the full amount.

Optionally, pass in a lesser amount for a partial refund.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of payment to refund.

parameters.name: X-Idempotency-Key
parameters.description: Optional key to make the request idempotent. Learn more in the [Idempotency Key guide](../docs#idempotency-key).

error.description: The payment could not be found
We were unable to validate your request, please check your payload against https://primer.io/docs/api

errors.description: Value must be a valid integer

post.description:
<p/>

Resume a payment's workflow execution from a paused state. This
is usually required when a Workflow was paused in order to get further information
from the customer, or when waiting for an asynchronous response from a third
party connection.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of payment to resume.

error.description: The payment could not be found

post.description:
<p/>

Adjust authorized amount. This is only possible if `authorizationType` was set to 
`ESTIMATED` when the payment was created, and the mechanism is supported by the payment method.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of payment for adjusting authorization.

error.description: Adjust authorization is only allowed on payments where authorizationType is set to estimated and not final.
Adjust Authorization is only allowed on authorized payments.
Adjust Authorization is only available on card payments.
Adjust Authorization for processor X is not supported.
No matching Payment could be found.

post.description:
<p/>

Save a `SINGLE_USE` payment method token so it can be used
again later. You can optionally choose to verify the payment method
before vaulting. If verification fails, no payment method data will
be vaulted. Verification can minimise fraud and boost subscription
rates for recurring payments.

If you try to vault an already vaulted token, you will get the existing vaulted token back.

parameters.description: Payment method token to store.

schema.title: Payment Method Token
schema.description: Payment method token

parameters.name: paymentMethodToken

We were unable to validate your request, please check your payload against https://primer.io/docs/api

post.description:
The Observability API is currently in beta. Please contact [support@primer.io](mailto:support@primer.io) for access.

Creating a payment with the Observability API sends external payments data to Primer to populate [Observability Payment Insights dashboards](https://primer.io/observability). Payments created through the [Payments API](/reference/create_payment_payments_post) will be automatically populated and do not need to be sent in the Observability API.

Create an API key with the `observability-payments:write` scope.

Each record must be created with a unique `paymentId`. To update a payment record with new data use the `PATCH` endpoint.

patch.description:
The Observability API is currently in beta. Please contact [support@primer.io](mailto:support@primer.io) for access.

You can update payments created earlier through the Observability API with this endpoint. The only required field for the request is `paymentId`. Other supported request fields are the same as for the [create an external payment](/reference/external_payment) API call.

If you wish to update nested fields on the payment, you only need to pass the fields that you wish to update. For example to update the processor name, you would pass in `processor.name` only.

The response will contain all the fields of the payment including the ones that were changed.

get.summary: Get a loyalty customer's points balance
get.description:
The Loyalty API is currently in beta.
Please contact [support@primer.io](mailto:support@primer.io) for access.

Create an API key with the `loyalty-transactions:read` scopes.

Get a loyalty customer by ID and connection ID. This includes the customer's points balance.

The `connectionId` is the unique Primer identifier for your loyalty provider connection. Primer will provide this once the loyalty provider connection is created.

The `customerId` refers to the customer identifier on the loyalty provider's side.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: ID of the Primer connection configuration.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the customer on the loyalty provider.

error.description: The provided connection ID doesn't exist.
error.recoverySuggestion: Please provide a valid connection ID.

post.description:
The Loyalty API is currently in beta.
Please contact [support@primer.io](mailto:support@primer.io) for access.

Create an API key with the `loyalty-transactions:write` scopes.

Create a loyalty transaction. This is either a points redemption or a points refund.

error.description: The provided connection ID doesn't exist.
error.recoverySuggestion: Please provide a valid connection ID.

error.description: We were unable to validate your request, please check your payload against https://primer.io/docs/api

errors.description: Value must be a valid string

get.summary: List the transactions for a customer
get.description:
The Loyalty API is currently in beta.
Please contact [support@primer.io](mailto:support@primer.io) for access.

Create an API key with the `loyalty-transactions:read` scopes.

Get all your loyalty transactions. You can filter by `connectionId` (recommended) and by `customerId` and `orderId`.

Additionally provide a `limit` to restrict the number of transactions in the response, and an `offset` to determine where to start.

parameters.description: Filter transactions by customer Id.
parameters.name: connectionId

parameters.description: Filter transactions by customer Id.
parameters.name: customerId

parameters.description: Filter transactions by orderId.
parameters.name: orderId

parameters.description: Limit the number of returned results
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: The number of items to skip before returning results
parameters.name: offset

error.description: The provided connection ID doesn't exist.
error.recoverySuggestion: Please provide a valid connection ID.

error.description: Invalid type for `orderId`
error.recoverySuggestion: OrderID must be a valid string

CardNetworkEnum.title: CardNetworkEnum
CardNetworkEnum.description: The list of available card networks.

clientToken.title: Client token
clientToken.description: Client token for use in the Primer-JS SDK obtained via `POST` /client-session API call.

customerId.title: The ID of the customer using the checkout.
customerId.description: A unique identifier for your customer.

currencyCode.title: Currency
currencyCode.description:
The 3-letter currency code in [ISO 4217 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes).
e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

amount.title: Payment amount
amount.description:
The amount you would like to charge the customer, in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

Some currencies, such as Japanese Yen, do not have minor units. In this case you should use the value as it is, without any formatting. For example for 100, use `100`.

If the amount is provided on this level, it would override any amount calculated from the provided line items, shipping and other amounts.

metadata.title: Payment Metadata
metadata.description:
Additional data to be used throughout the payment lifecycle.

Provide the entire object to update it. Anything provided previously will be overwritten.

customer.title: Customer Details
customer.description:
More information associated with the customer.

Each of the fields in this object must be updated in its entirety, i.e. provide the entire object to update it. Anything provided previously will be overwritten.

order.title: Order Details
order.description:
More information associated with the order.

Each of the fields in this object must be updated in its entirety, i.e. provide the entire object to update it. Anything provided previously will be overwritten.

paymentMethod.title: Payment Method Options
paymentMethod.description: Enable certain options associated with the payment method. Provide the entire object to update it. Anything provided previously will be overwritten.

The 3-letter currency code in [ISO 4217 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes).
e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

amount.title: Payment amount
amount.description:
The amount you would like to charge the customer, in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

Some currencies, such as Japanese Yen, do not have minor units. In this case you should use the value as it is, without any formatting. For example for 100, use `100`.

If the amount is provided on this level, it would override any amount calculated from the provided line items, shipping and other amounts.

A unique identifier for your customer.
Create a client session token with a `customerId` to enable the client-side SDK to retrieve and manage your customer's saved payment methods. A client session token also enables saving payment methods against this customer id.

customer.title: Customer Details
customer.description: More information associated with the customer.

metadata.title: Payment Metadata
metadata.description:
Additional data to be used throughout the payment lifecycle.

A dictionary of key-value pairs where the values can only be strings or
integers.

e.g. `{"productId": 1001, "merchantId": "a13bsd62s"}`

paymentMethod.title: Payment Method Options
paymentMethod.description: Enable certain options associated with the payment method.

lineItems.title: Line Items
lineItems.description: The details of the line items of the order.

countryCode.title: Country Code
countryCode.description: The country in which the order is created

retailerCountryCode.title: Retailer Country Code
retailerCountryCode.description: The country code of the retailer

amount.description: The fee amount charged to the customer, in minor  units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

description.description: A description of the fee, e.g. "Currency Conversion Fee".

OrderLineItemsAPISchema.title: OrderLineItemsAPISchema
OrderLineItemsAPISchema.description:
The details of the line items of the order.

The total amount of a line item is calculated like so: 
````
  totalAmount = (amount * quantity) - discountAmount + taxAmount
```

itemId.title: Item ID
itemId.description: A unique identifier for the line item.

amount.description: The amount charged to the customer, in minor units. The minimum amount is 0.

quantity.description: The number of the particular line item that is being ordered.

discountAmount.title: Discount Amount
discountAmount.description: Any discount applicable to this item, in minor units. This discount is applied for the entire line item, and not per `quantity`.

taxAmount.title: Tax Amount
taxAmount.description: The tax charged on this item, in minor units. This tax amount is applied for the entire line item, and not per `quantity`.

taxCode.title: Tax Code
taxCode.description: The tax code associated with this item, in minor units. This is required for Primer-initiated tax calculations.

productType.title: Product Type
productType.description: An identifier for the product type.

globalTradeItemNumber.title: Global Trade Item Number
globalTradeItemNumber.description: The product Global Trade Item Number (e.g. ISBN)

weightUnit.title: SKU
weightUnit.description: The product weight unit (e.g. kg, g)

amount.description: The shipping amount charged to the customer, in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

vaultOnSuccess.description: Whether the payment method should be vaulted on a successful payment or not.

vaultOn3DS.description: Whether the payment method should be vaulted after a successful 3DS authentication or not.

descriptor.title: Payment descriptor
descriptor.description: A description of the payment, as it would typically appear on a bank statement.

options.title: Payment Method Options
options.description:
Additional options for the payment methods represented as dictionary 
with key of [available payment methods](https://primer.io/docs/payment-methods/available-payment-methods) and value of corresponding options.

authorizationType.title: Authorization Type
authorizationType.description:
Allows to adjust the authorized amount after the authorization, if supported by payment method.
`FINAL` - the authorized amount is final and can not be adjusted. Adjusting the amount can be only done via canceling the payment and re-authorization with new amount.
`ESTIMATED` - the amount can be adjusted after the authorization, if supported by payment method.

CheckoutPaymentMethodOptionAPISchema.title: PaymentMethodOptionAPISchema
CheckoutPaymentMethodOptionAPISchema.description: Options for the payment method of type `PAYMENT_METHOD_TYPE`.

networks.title: Card networks
networks.description: Dictionary of available card networks as a key with value of Payment Method Card Network Option.

amount.description: The surcharge amount, in minor units. Surcharge amount must be used in conjunction with line item amounts, if a top level amount is passed then surcharge will not be calculated.

vaultOnSuccess.description: Whether the payment method should be vaulted on a successful payment or not.

vaultOn3DS.description: Whether the payment method should be vaulted after a successful 3DS authentication or not.

descriptor.title: Payment descriptor
descriptor.description: A description of the payment, as it would typically appear on a bank statement.

authorizationType.title: Authorization Type
authorizationType.description:
Allows to adjust the authorized amount after the authorization, if supported by payment method.
`FINAL` - the authorized amount is final and can not be adjusted. Adjusting the amount can be only done via canceling the payment and re-authorization with new amount.
`ESTIMATED` - the amount can be adjusted after the authorization, if supported by payment method.
Defaults to `FINAL`.

descriptor.title: Payment descriptor

on a bank statement.

paymentMethodToken.description: The payment method token used to authorize the transaction.

isVaulted.description: Whether the payment method token represents a vaulted payment method and can be used for future payments.

Adjusting the amount can be only done via canceling the payment and re-authorization with new amount. `ESTIMATED` - the amount can be adjusted after the authorization, if supported by payment method.

If one or more partial captures were performed, this value will be a sum
of all partial capture amounts.

If no refund was performed, this value will be set to `0`.

If one or more partial refunds were performed, this value will be a sum
of all partial refund amounts.

e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

amount.title: Payment amount
amount.description: The amount you charged the customer, in minor units.

order.title: Order Details
order.description: More information associated with the order.

customerId.title: The ID of the customer using the checkout
customerId.description: The unique identifier for your customer.

customer.title: Customer Details
customer.description: More information associated with the customer.

metadata.title: Payment Metadata
metadata.description: Additional data to be used throughout the payment lifecycle.

paymentMethod.title: Payment Method Options
paymentMethod.description: The payment method options provided in the request, as well as the token used to process the payment.

processor.title: Processor Information
processor.description: More information associated with the payment processor, including the processor name.

requiredAction.title: Required action
requiredAction.description: Required action to perform in order to resume the payment workflow. This can be requiring a 3DS check from the customer for instance.

statusReason.title: Status Reason
statusReason.description: Check this field for more information regarding the payment's status. This is especially useful when the status is `DECLINED` or `FAILED`.

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.description:
A list summarizing the transactions that occurred while processing the payment.

Note: a refund is a separate transaction and so will appear in this `transactions` list if a refund was performed.

reason.title: Cancellation reason
reason.description: You can optionally specify a reason for the cancellation. This is for your own records.

processor.title: Processor
processor.description: The payment processor to use for this payment.

amount.title: Amount to capture
amount.description:
The amount you would like to capture, in minor units. The currency used on authorization is assumed.

If no amount is specified it defaults to the full amount.

final.title: Final capture
final.description:
Indicates whether the capture request is the final capture request.

After a final capture, no subsequent captures are allowed.

order.title: Order
order.description: More information associated with the order.

retailerCountryCode.title: Retailer Country Code
retailerCountryCode.description:
The country code of the retailer.
This field is passed to the processor and overwrites the retailer country code set in order details.

isNetworkTokenized.title: Is represented by a digital PAN

currencyCode.title: Currency
currencyCode.description:
The 3-letter currency code in [ISO 4217 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes).
e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

amount.title: Payment amount
amount.description:
The amount you would like to charge the customer, in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

Some currencies, such as Japanese Yen, do not have minor units. In this case you should use the value as it is, without any formatting. For example for 100, use `100`. The minimum amount is 0.

order.title: Order Details
order.description: More information associated with the order.

paymentMethodToken.title: Payment method token
paymentMethodToken.description: The payment method token used to authorize the payment.

customerId.title: The ID of the customer using the checkout
customerId.description:
A unique identifier for your customer.
This attribute is required if `paymentMethod.vaultOnSuccess` is set to `True`.

customer.title: Customer Details
customer.description: More information associated with the customer.

metadata.title: Payment Metadata
metadata.description:
Additional data to be used throughout the payment lifecycle.

A dictionary of key-value pairs where the values can only be strings or
integers.

e.g. `{"productId": 1001, "merchantId": "a13bsd62s"}`

paymentMethod.title: Payment Method Options
paymentMethod.description: Enable certain options associated with the payment method.

declineType.title: Decline Type
declineType.description:
If the error is of type `ISSUER_DECLINED` this will be returned.

Declines of type `SOFT_DECLINE` may be retried,
whereas declines of type `HARD_DECLINE` should not be retried.

code.title: Payment status code
code.description: If the error is of type `ISSUER_DECLINED`, this will be returned.

message.title: Processor message
message.description: In case of an error on the processor's part, we will return the message returned by the processor. This is usually a human readable error.

RiskDataAPISchema.title: RiskDataAPISchema
RiskDataAPISchema.description: Risk data associated with this payment.

FraudCheckAPISchema.title: FraudCheckAPISchema
FraudCheckAPISchema.description: Results of the pre-authorization and post-authorization fraud checks.

PaymentMethodTypeEnum.title: PaymentMethodTypeEnum
PaymentMethodTypeEnum.description: Payment method type, where `OFF_SESSION_PAYMENT` is used for APM (Alternative Payment Method) payments and `PAYMENT_CARD` for traditional debit or credit cards. Please note that this list is different from one indicated on [available payment methods](https://primer.io/docs/payment-methods/available-payment-methods) page and values of this field will be changed in the future versions of the API.

amount.title: Amount to refund
amount.description:
The amount you would like to refund the customer, in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

Defaults to remaining non-refunded amount.

orderId.title: Order ID
orderId.description:
Optionally you can pass a specific order ID for the refund.

By default this will be set to the original `orderId` given on payment creation.

reason.title: Refund reason
reason.description: You can optionally specify a reason for the refund. This is for your own records.

description.title: Description
description.description: Human description of the required action to perform.

clientToken.title: Client token
clientToken.description: The client token to be returned to the SDK if a required action is returned.

resumeToken.title: Resume token
resumeToken.description: A token containing any information that is sent back from the checkout to complete a blocked payment flow.

id.title: Payment identifier
id.description:
The unique payment ID.

You can use this ID to retrieve the payment details, or perform downstream
operations.

date.title: Payment date
date.description: The date and time at which the payment was created in UTC format.

status.title: Current status
status.description: See the payment [status table](../docs#payment-status) for more information.

processor.title: Processor
processor.description: The payment processor used for this payment.

currencyCode.title: Currency
currencyCode.description:
The 3-letter currency code in [ISO 4217 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes).
e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

amount.title: Payment amount
amount.description: The payment amount, in minor units. e.g. $7 would show as `700`.

metadata.title: Payment Metadata
metadata.description:
Additional data to be used throughout the payment lifecycle.

A dictionary of key-value pairs where the values can only be strings or
integers.

e.g. `{"productId": 1001, "merchantId": "a13bsd62s"}`

amount.title: Payment amount
amount.description:
The **final** amount you would like to charge the customer, in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

Some currencies, such as Japanese Yen, do not have minor units. In this case you should use the value as it is, without any formatting. For example for 100, use `100`.

If the amount is provided on this level, it would override any amount calculated from the provided line items, shipping and other amounts.

processorMerchantId.title: Processor Merchant ID
processorMerchantId.description: The processor's merchant ID used to authorize the payment.

name.title: Processor Name
name.description: The processor name should be provided if the processorMerchantId is not unique across all of your integrations.

name.title: Processor Name
name.description: The payment processor used for this payment.

processorMerchantId.title: Processor Merchant ID
processorMerchantId.description: The merchant ID registered at the payment processor used for this payment.

RecurringPaymentTypeSchema.title: Recurring Payment Type
RecurringPaymentTypeSchema.description:
Payment types, primarily to be used for recurring payments.
Note: If you successfully vault a `SINGLE_USE` token on payment creation, then there's no need to set a value for this field and it will be flagged as `FIRST_PAYMENT`. Otherwise, see the table below for all possible values.

| paymentType | Use case |
| --- | --- |
| `FIRST_PAYMENT` | a customer-initiated payment which is the first in a series of recurring payments or subscription, or a card on file scenario.
| `ECOMMERCE` | a customer-initiated payment using stored payment details where the cardholder is present.
| `SUBSCRIPTION` | a merchant-initiated payment as part of a series of payments on a fixed schedule and a set amount.
| `UNSCHEDULED` | a merchant-initiated payment using stored payment details with no fixed schedule or amount.

ThreeDSecureFailedReasonCodeEnum.title: ThreeDSecureFailedReasonCodeEnum
ThreeDSecureFailedReasonCodeEnum.description:
This enum is derived from the `transStatusReason` on page 218 of the
[EMV Co 3DS protocol specification](https://www.emvco.com/terms-of-use/?u=/wp-content/uploads/documents/EMVCo_3DS_Spec_v220_122018.pdf)

| Code | Description                             |
|------|-----------------------------------------|
| 01   | Card authentication failed              |
| 02   | Unknown Device                          |
| 03   | Unsupported Device                      |
| 04   | Exceeds authentication frequency limit  |
| 05   | Expired card                            |
| 06   | Invalid card number                     |
| 07   | Invalid transaction                     |
| 08   | No Card record                          |
| 09   | Security failure                        |
| 10   | Stolen card                             |
| 11   | Suspected fraud                         |
| 12   | Transaction not permitted to cardholder |
| 13   | Cardholder not enrolled in service      |
| 14   | Transaction timed out at the ACS        |
| 15   | Low confidence                          |
| 16   | Medium confidence                       |

currencyCode.title: Currency
currencyCode.description:
The 3-letter currency code in [ISO 4217 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes).
e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

processorTransactionId.title: Processor's transaction ID
processorTransactionId.description: Processor's unique identifier for the transaction

processorMerchantId.title: Processor master account identifier
processorMerchantId.description:
Processor's main account identifier.

* Adyen: Account code
* Braintree: Merchant ID
* Stripe: Account ID"

processorStatus.title: Processor Transaction status
processorStatus.description: Transaction status, please refer to the [Transaction Status Codes](#section/API-Usage-Guide/Payment-Status) table for more information

processorStatusReason.title: Payment error
processorStatusReason.description:
If the transaction has a declined or failed status.

Only if the status is `DECLINED` or `FAILED`, otherwise `null`.

addressLine1.title: Address Line 1
addressLine1.description: Street name, Company name or PO Box

city.title: City
city.description: Name of the city, district, town or village

addressLine1.title: Address Line 1
addressLine1.description: Street name, Company name or PO Box

city.title: City
city.description: Name of the city, district, town or village

createdAt.title: Creation date
createdAt.description: Creation date & time of the object (UTC)

deletedAt.title: Revocation date
deletedAt.description: Date & time when this object was revoked. (UTC)

deleted.title: Revoked
deleted.description: Whether or not this object has been revoked.

tokenType.title: Token type
tokenType.description: * `MULTI_USE` a vaulted token that can be re-used with subsequent payments

analyticsId.title: Unique analytics ID
analyticsId.description: Unique analytics identifier corresponding to a payment method

paymentMethodType.title: Payment method type
paymentMethodType.description: Payment method type associated with a token.

description.title: Description
description.description: A friendly description given by the user

default.title: Default
default.description: Whether or not this payment method is the default

isVerified.title: Payment method verified
isVerified.description: Whether or not this payment method was verified

verify.description: Whether the payment method should be verified before vaulting or not

id.title: Loyalty Customer ID
id.description: The unique identifier for the customer on the loyalty provider.

connectionId.title: Connection ID
connectionId.description: ID of the Primer connection configuration.

connectionId.title: Connection ID
connectionId.description: ID of the Primer connection configuration.

customerId.title: Loyalty Customer ID
customerId.description: The unique identifier for the customer on the loyalty provider.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value of points to redeem.

date.title: Transaction date
date.description: Creation date & time of the transaction (UTC)

id.title: Transaction ID
id.description: Unique Primer identifier for the loyalty transaction.

connectionId.title: Connection ID
connectionId.description: ID of the Primer connection configuration.

customerId.title: Loyalty Customer ID
customerId.description: The unique identifier for the customer on the loyalty provider.

connectionTransactionId.title: Provider Transaction ID
connectionTransactionId.description: ID of the transaction on the loyalty provider's side.

total.title: Total results
total.description: The total number of available results

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: The limit of the paged result

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: The offset of the paged result

issuerCountryCode.description:
2-letter country code in [ISO 3166-1](
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) alpha format,
e.g. FR for France and GB for the United Kingdom.

issuerName.description: The name of the issuing bank.

productUsageType.description: The usage type of the payment card e.g. commercial, consumer.

accountFundingType.description: The funding type of the payment card e.g. credit, debit, prepaid.

id.description: The order reference for the payment.

countryCode.description:
2-letter country code in [ISO 3166-1](
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2#Officially_assigned_code_elements) alpha format,
e.g. FR for France and GB for the United Kingdom.

paymentId.description:
The payment ID.

The payment ID must be unique. You can use this unique payment ID to update payment details.

currencyCode.description:
The 3-letter currency code in
[ISO 4217 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes).

e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

amount.description:
The amount you would like to charge the customer,
in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

Some currencies, such as Japanese Yen, do not have minor units.
In this case you should use the value as it is, without any formatting.
For example for 100, use `100`.
The minimum amount is 0.

createdAt.description:
The payment creation date and time (UTC) in [ISO 8601 format](
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

Cannot be updated in partial updates PATCH.

status.description:
See the payment [status table](
https://apiref.primer.io/docs#payment-status) for more information.

statusReason.description:
Pass more information regarding the payment's status in this field.

This is especially useful when the status is `DECLINED` or `FAILED`.

metadata.description:
Additional data to be used throughout the payment lifecycle.

Ad dictionary of key-value pairs where the values can only be strings or integers.

e.g. `{"productId": 1001, "merchantId": "88278a"}`

paymentType.description:
Payment types, primarily to be used for recurring payments.

Note: If you successfully vault a `SINGLE_USE` token on payment
creation, then there's no need to set a value for this field and it will
be flagged as `FIRST_PAYMENT`. Otherwise, see the table below for all
possible values.


| paymentType | Use case |
| --- | --- |
| `FIRST_PAYMENT` | a customer-initiated payment which is the first in a series of recurring payments or subscription, or a card on file scenario. |
| `ECOMMERCE` | a customer-initiated payment using stored payment details where the cardholder is present. |
| `SUBSCRIPTION` | a merchant-initiated payment as part of a series of payments on a fixed schedule and a set amount. |
| `UNSCHEDULED` | a merchant-initiated payment using stored payment details with no fixed schedule or amount. |
| `MOTO` | a merchant-initiated mail order or telephone order payment. |
| `IN_STORE` | a customer-initiated payment where the customer is physically present in a shop. |

descriptor.description:
A description of the payment,
as it would typically appear on a bank statement.

The payment ID.

The payment ID must be unique. You can use this unique payment ID to update payment details.

The 3-letter currency code in
[ISO 4217 format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes).

e.g. use `USD` for US dollars.

The amount you would like to charge the customer,
in minor units. e.g. for $7, use `700`.

Some currencies, such as Japanese Yen, do not have minor units.
In this case you should use the value as it is, without any formatting.
For example for 100, use `100`.
The minimum amount is 0.

Cannot be updated in partial updates PATCH.

This is especially useful when the status is `DECLINED` or `FAILED`.

Ad dictionary of key-value pairs where the values can only be strings or integers.

e.g. `{"productId": 1001, "merchantId": "88278a"}`

paymentType.description:
Payment types, primarily to be used for recurring payments.

Note: If you successfully vault a `SINGLE_USE` token on payment
creation, then there's no need to set a value for this field and it will
be flagged as `FIRST_PAYMENT`. Otherwise, see the table below for all
possible values.


| paymentType | Use case |
| --- | --- |
| `FIRST_PAYMENT` | a customer-initiated payment which is the first in a series of recurring payments or subscription, or a card on file scenario. |
| `ECOMMERCE` | a customer-initiated payment using stored payment details where the cardholder is present. |
| `SUBSCRIPTION` | a merchant-initiated payment as part of a series of payments on a fixed schedule and a set amount. |

descriptor.description:
A description of the payment,
as it would typically appear on a bank statement.

paymentMethodType.description: Payment method type used for payment authorization.

first6Digits.description:
The first six digits of the card used for payment,
also known as the Bank Identification Number (BIN).

name.description:
The payment processor used for this payment.
Primer supports the above processors through the Payments API,
however any value can be passed here.

merchantId.description: The merchant ID registered at the payment processor used for this payment.

declineType.description:
Declines of type `SOFT_DECLINE` may have been retried.
Whereas declines of type `HARD_DECLINE` should have not been retried.

code.description:
Payment status code with the error code when
the issuer declined the payment.

message.description:
Message detail returned by the processor when
the error on appeared on their part.

responseCode.description: The response returned during the 3D Secure authentication call.

challengeIssued.description:
The challenge status of the 3D Secure authentication.
Set to false for frictionless 3D Secure authentication.

protocolVersion.description: The protocol version used during 3D Secure authentication.

reasonCode.description: The reason code for unsuccessful 3D Secure authentication attempts.

reasonText.description:
The human readable reason text for unsuccessful
3D Secure authentication attempts.

ErrorObject.title: Error
ErrorObject.description: An object containing information about the error that occurred.

description.title: Error description
description.description: A human readable description of the error

diagnosticsId.title: Error diagnostics ID
diagnosticsId.description: An ID that you can quote when contacting the support team (support@primer.io).

validationErrors.title: Validation Errors
validationErrors.description: Returned in case of a badly formed request

AuthorizationTypeEnum.title: AuthorizationTypeEnum
AuthorizationTypeEnum.description: Type of authorization for the payment.
